instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shows orange light when battery is disconnected
threads.message: Hello Guys, I have a macbook pro i7  that has some light water damage on it. When i connect the charger to the computer without the battery it shows me a orange light as if its charging. It doesnt boot. Im assuming there is a problem with the current sensing. During visual inspection I was able to find some unhealthy components near the <CHIP>ISL95870</CHIP>.  I did a beep test on both sides of this capacitor and it beeped to ground. The resistanc eof the resistor that apears besides that cap is 10.7Ohms.  I have also reballed this ic since some pads were corroded. I would love to measure my main power rails and troubleshoot it a bit more but i dont have the brd and schematic for this board. Can anyone share or enlighten me? Thanks

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shows orange light when battery is disconnected
threads.message: Airs and retinas always have orange light with battery disconnected. What is wrong with it, is it not charging, not seeing a battery, or is it working fine? This is normal behavior.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shows orange light when battery is disconnected
threads.message: Ohh good to know. I didnt know that. Atm the macbool doesnt turn on at all when u press the power button. I already tried a nw top case.
